page.title: 06HAREFIELD HEART HOSPITAL
page.content: This hospital was founded in 1915 for Australians wounded in the First World War.In 1937 a sanitorium was built for the treatment of TB patients. Today it has become world famous for heart transplant operations as well as thoracic surgery.Between 130 and 140 beds are available,with 40 for geriatric patients and others for the treatment of general illnesses. The hospital gets a National Health Service grant of 7.5 million pounds per year and has treated a number of famous people, including the late comic Eric Morecombe. Although the grounds of the hospital cover some 60 to 70 acres plans are afoot to sell some of the land in order to raise further funds.within the next ten years a new building programme will have significantly increased its capabilities.
